channel.title: IMPOSSIBLE to host?
channel.description: Hello, i was wondering is it impossible to host? I have a brand new labtop one of the acer mini ones and i cant host! Could this be because of my internet? I have a westell modem and bellsouth internet service. I can't host for some reason though? So back to the question. . . is it impossible to host on some computers? P.S. If this is in the wrong section please move (i think its in the right one)

item.title: IMPOSSIBLE to host?
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Taintisacoder:

is it impossible to host on some computers?

No, the only computers that cant host are those without a network card/modem. You dont have a laptop, you have a netbook so you should have no problem with hosting.

Read full topic

item.title: IMPOSSIBLE to host?
item.dc:creator: @triple629 triple629
item.description:
@triple629 wrote:

or just go direct connection thats what i used to do when i was a noob

Read full topic

item.title: IMPOSSIBLE to host?
item.dc:creator: @lildude783 lildude783
item.description:
@lildude783 wrote:

… ok open ur port 43594 in ur firewall exceptions and then go to ur RUN command thing or ur command prompt …

if u go to RUN then type in cmd and click enter

if u go to command prompt then do wat i say next

type in ipconfig on the screen that shows up and click enter
and then find ur default gateway

once u find ur default gateway go into ur internet and type in ur default gateway and go to the website… put in ur pass and username when the pop up shows up and then just folo port forwarding steps!

if u have more than one default gateway … get the one starting with 192.168..** cuz that is ur right one

if u go to one that is 198.168.255.255 that could be ur subnet mask and u could make a hamachi server and mess up ur entire router like my homie gh0stly k1ll did

so do it rite the first time!

Read full topic

item.description:
@triple629 wrote:

i had this problem just follow the how to make a server tutorial and make sure you port forward
